comments.commentBody: How does this relate to a train that would have arrived on time and stopped safely if the engineer wasn't asleep or distracted? Or is that a false equivalence?

New Jersey and New York make billions of dollars in fees from various transportation schemes which includes The Port Authority of NY and NJ. There's the NJ Turnpike Authority, The NY Thruway Authority, The Delaware Ports Authority and more.
What happens to the revenues from these transportation management systems? The NJTP was opened in 1949. Surely those bonds are redeemed by now? And yes I know there have been improvements but when was the last time you saw an improvement? Especially on the South Jersey end? The Delaware Memorial Bridge was a one bridge route for decade, how long ago was the second bridge added? You can spend a lot of time looking at the accounting for these piggy banks and come up with no answers.
How much do the fees and fares keep increasing and why does none of it go to infrastructure improvements? Hundreds of toll collector jobs were eliminated by EZPASS. After the machinery was paid for where did the money go?
Part of the problem is that each of these systems has become a fief of it's own. Some have millions in reserves some are short. Politics determine where a lot of it is spent.
It is past time to look at the two states and see if combining these pools of money could do more. And road use taxes on gasoline should be going to roads not building commuter rail and bus routes. Let the users of these systems pay the cost through their ticket stubs.
Better yet, sell all of them to private industry with strict oversight over profits and improvements.

My guess is that in general, rail systems are not a desireable investment in the current political atmophere. Because government owns them many of the environmental hurddles are waived. Few investors would want to suffer otherwise.

NJ Transit has chronically been shortchanged by NJ politicians, but it's gotten much much worse during the Christie regime, when he has repeatedly cut NJ's share of funding for the trains (causing huge fare hikes), refused Federal funds for train project like the Hudson River Tunnel project (did THAT money even get repaid to the Feds?), generally refused to do anything about the states's crumbling infrastructure, trains, and roads, and even grasped any monies meant for these sorts of projects to "balance" his budgets!

Meanwhile, he's busy cutting windfall "settlements" with the likes of Exxon Mobil costing the state of NJ literally $billions! (The Exxon deal along cost NJ over $8 BILLION, settling a $8.9 fine for $225 million!)

All these NJ Transit catastrophes stem from a lack of funding and safety updating! Put the blame where it belongs: on Christie!
It is, by 1 presidential candidate-- Hillary.
In many families, a sneezing fit might be accompanied by a "Gesundheit" or a "God bless you."  We say, "T'kiah!"
Love it!  I'll have to try that at home :)

Heidi! I thought the name looked familiar.
If you'll wear Black & White checks, I'll look for you at JR.

Masterful defusion, R/Elke. Tikotevu only all good.

and Elke
Due to time constraints , used "aids" such as reveal to speed up the solving experience.
Was certain of L-DOPA , one of the components of Sinemet, the other is Carbi-dopa. Also had the correct spelling of VICHYSSOISE ( a favorite summer soup, but not with matzoh spheroids).
We have the BABYBJORN right down the middle , but the BEBE is off to the side.....that's not comfortable for carrier or carried ONE.

Will be gone for a few days , to listen to - BLASTs from what could be thought of as an original GHETTOBLASTER ( this is intended as a joke and I hope it is taken as such ) i.e. a shofar.

Want to take this opportunity to wish all to whom this matters, a year of good health, peace, happiness and much cruciverbal success.
L'Shana Tova U'Metuka.

Would it be less upsetting had the engineer died? Or been seriously injured? One less life lost is a good thing. And I suspect the NTSB is thankful the engineer is able to provide information to help them figure out how this accident happened. I also suspect that the engineer is FAR MORE UPSET THAN YOU that passengers on his train were injured.

not both sides of the isle - the governor of NJ turned down billions to build a new tunnel under the Hudson River - bankrupted the transportation trust fund in NJ - and under funds NJ transit - guess what party. I also seem to remember eight years of the President proposing infrastructure spending which got nowhere - maybe because a certain party could only apply their efforts to make him a one term president. Lets get real.
That would assume that everyone on that train had a seat - a dangerous assumption.

To all those naming names and stating "never rinse pasta" please take a closer look the recipe. You don't have to worry about any sauce sticking to the pasta because it's a baked casserole, not pasta tossed with sauce. As Lynn noted earlier, just make it as written and see what you get.
I'm not an anchovy person, so thank you for this.  What's your take on the oil?  Others have commented to pare it down.  Your thoughts?
I found anchovy paste to taste to be a good middle ground.  It gives more body to the flavors but doesn't overwhelm or taste fishy.
Made this tonight and the anchovies just didn't do it for me.  Will definitely make this again and will try capers or preserved lemon.

Cooked as presented and it was delicious. The sauce was silky and delicate; the partakers ecstatic. (Yuck? -- Lotti must have screwed up somehow) Agree that just about any green will work -- I used beet greens, 'cuz I had them.
Fabulous recipe, I was a little sceptical about the cinnamon, what an amazing flavor it adds. Would make this again and again!
They are fresh peppers, not dried, if I read the recipe correctly.
They need to be simmered in water.
yes - i had the same concern but it was totally fine - just add the liquid once you smell the chiles
In step 3, are the dried peppers really placed in an empty pot on med-high heat? No oil or anything? They just cook in an empty pot for 5-7 minutes without burning?

very delicioius and very strongly spiced.  I wanted more than one egg for my portion though.  Another egg would be better because the bland eggs are a good counterpoint to cut through the spices.  My teenage son wasnt' a big fan.  It will be really good warmed over in the micro at work tomorrow.
I had these tacos tonight and I was in love. The pork shredding was a little time consuming. But well worth it. The slaw was very good but even better on top of the pork.
I'd say it's less voyeurism than simply detachment from reality. Or maybe she was quite conscious and thinking about selling the footage. Either way, disgraceful.

The punch line is going to be some blameless diagnosis of "Hudson River Train Engineer Blah-out" - like the one below Yonkers...

Is it coincidence that all of these folks are at a point just before retirement - where they work unbridled hours of overtime to bolster their pensions???

You don't have to take off, land, parallel-park - or even steer the thing...

Could you at least just slow down or stop, at the appropriate time???

Boy Howdy. Until passengers have departed the area rail employees are responsible for public safety. Rendering aid is no different for them than police. Like my boss used to say, "That goes with the territory."
Of course I'm only talking about commuter and long distance rail.
It's a new world post Reagan.  Two generations have grown up not knowing the meaning of good governance.
Well, you still  would need to consider the train traffic density there and here. Little different.

Yes, and the whole system is third world. In CT ( Metro North), the high electric voltage from the overhead Catenary can only be used by rail cars designed to accept it overhead. On Hudson Line , third rail power is provided but not for certain sections.

This requires a constant jumble of different designed self powered cars for the different elctrified sections with a mix of Diesel locomotives to fill in the gaps.

That means both push and pull Diesel power is used as was the case at Hoboken. Remote control appears to have failed here, with locomotive pushing without brakes applied.

The design is ancient and maintenance is poor, we need a "moon shot" to get up to 21st century.

For god's sake, she stopped being a Goldwater girl when she was a teenager.

Please get out of your blind bunker and listen to Bernie: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/larry-womack/stop-pretending-you-dont-_b_1...

"She wouldn’t be so suspicious of the press, or so measured in her presentation ... if she had been born a man.

"The lengths we go to in order to rationalize this all will be seen, in retrospect, as extraordinary.

"When the Bush administration was discovered to have erased millions of emails illegally sent by 22 administration officials through private, RNC-owned accounts, in order to thwart an investigation into the politically motivated firing of eight US attorneys, just one talk show covered it that Sunday."

"When Hillary Clinton asked Colin Powell how he managed to use a Blackberry while serving as Secretary of State, he replied by detailing his method of intentionally bypassing federal record-keeping laws"

"Yet the fact that Hillary Clinton emailed through a private server and didn’t use it to cover anything up is somehow the defining issue of her campaign. “My God,” people cry, “anyone else would be in jail!”

"Or is the real scandal that her family runs but does not profit from a charitable foundation awarded an A grade by Charity Watch ... helping 435 million people in 180 countries get things like clean drinking water and HIV medication?"

Because we live in 50 subcountries with different regional priorities. To get done what you're talking about would require Roosevelt levels of support and political skill. He had opponents who HATED him and this level of federal control. For heaven's sake, we need to start by having a regional alliance. The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey can't even get their act together. The current Penn Station is a perfect metaphor, a ridiculous crumbling patchwork of companies that don't cooperate. Just look at the signage. Absurd.
People in New Jersey do pay more taxes. Where do they go? Isn't that a great questions.

"Officials would say only that the train was traveling much too fast at the time of the crash".

Ya think? It was the end of the line.
We need to pay for wars.
